examples: He made a sudden movement and frightened the bird away.
For a long time after the accident, he had no movement in (= was unable to move) his legs.

body_content.explanation: what someone is doing during a particular period:
examples: I don't know his movements this week.

body_content.explanation: a group of people with a particular set of aims or ideas :
examples: The suffragette movement campaigned for votes for women.
He was a prominent member of the artistic movement known as the Ashcan School.
Mulligan became involved in a movement to develop a different style of jazz.

body_content.explanation: a situation in which people change their opinion or the way that they live or work:
examples: There has been a movement towards more women going back to work while their children are still young.
Recently there has been some movement away from traditional methods of teaching.

body_content.explanation: an occasion when something develops, changes, or happens in a particular way or direction:
examples: There has been little movement in the dollar (= it has not changed in value very much) today.

body_content.explanation: one of the main parts of a piece of classical music:
examples: Beethoven's fifth symphony has four movements.

body_content.explanation: the part of a clock or watch that turns the hands (= thin sticks) that point to the time
(used especially by doctors and nurses) an act of emptying the bowels:
examples: When did you last have a (bowel) movement?
